did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle: Correspondence of the Poe Memorial Association 1899-1911

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Correspondence of the Poe Memorial Association, Accession #38-406, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The papers consist chiefly of letters to Charles William Kent from literary notables and other dignitaries invited to an unveiling of the Zolnay bust of Edgar Allan Poe in the University of Virginia Rotunda on October 7, 1899. Miscellaneous papers include clippings about Poe, an account for the event, and a poem "At Poe's grave" by William Winter, read by Sara Sigourney Rice.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The letters are arranged alphabetically by correspondent's last name, and chronologically within each correspondent for those with more than one letter.
